Abstract: This study explores the intricate relationship between leader thinking skills and follower creative performance, emphasizing the role of leadership in fostering innovation within organizations. By analyzing the impact of leader development on enhancing creativity among followers, the research delves into how leaders' cognitive abilities and strategic thinking influence the creative outcomes of their teams. Utilizing a comprehensive review of existing literature and empirical data, the paper identifies key mechanisms through which leaders can effectively stimulate creativity and innovation in their followers. The findings suggest that leaders who cultivate advanced thinking skills and engage in continuous development are more likely to inspire high levels of creative performance in their teams, thereby contributing to organizational success in dynamic environments.
